text: Hey everyone, I’m Daniel, solo dev behind Rad Trails 2, a time-attack motocross racer for iOS. I’ve been building it for the past year and a half, and it’s almost ready for beta. This isn’t a full release or flashy marketing push, just a quick heads-up that I’m collecting early signups for the iOS beta. The build’s not quite live yet, but it’ll be rolling out soon. About the Game Rad Trails 2 is a fast-paced racing game built for flow. Races are short, retries are instant, and every run is about chasing the perfect line to get a better finishing time. You’ll compete in time-attack style races, racing your own ghost and others to climb the global leaderboards. The bike is controlled using your phone’s gyroscope to shift the rider’s weight – no buttons, just tilt. I know tilt controls sound sketchy, but in Rad Trails 2 they unlock a surprising amount of control and makes the game play feel very expressive. You can lean into a turn, throw a whip, or recover mid-air just by moving your phone naturally. It takes a little time to master, but once it clicks, it feels great. Sign up here: https://radtrails.com - Scroll down to the beta sign-up form and submit your email address and you're in! Also sharing early gameplay footage with the TouchArcade community. I would love to hear your thoughts. Share This Page
html:
1. Hey everyone,

    I’m Daniel, solo dev behind Rad Trails 2, a time-attack motocross racer for iOS. I’ve been building it for the past year and a half, and it’s almost ready for beta.

    This isn’t a full release or flashy marketing push, just a quick heads-up that I’m collecting early signups for the iOS beta. The build’s not quite live yet, but it’ll be rolling out soon.

    About the Game

    Rad Trails 2 is a fast-paced racing game built for flow. Races are short, retries are instant, and every run is about chasing the perfect line to get a better finishing time. You’ll compete in time-attack style races, racing your own ghost and others to climb the global leaderboards.

    The bike is controlled using your phone’s gyroscope to shift the rider’s weight – no buttons, just tilt. I know tilt controls sound sketchy, but in Rad Trails 2 they unlock a surprising amount of control and makes the game play feel very expressive. You can lean into a turn, throw a whip, or recover mid-air just by moving your phone naturally.

    It takes a little time to master, but once it clicks, it feels great.

    Sign up here: https://radtrails.com - Scroll down to the beta sign-up form and submit your email address and you're in!

    Also sharing early gameplay footage with the TouchArcade community. I would love to hear your thoughts.
